forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Light Rain Likely then Partly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 10pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds under a quilt of gray, as the anticipated rain begins to weave its way through the city, bringing the air a crisp edge. The high, hovering just above fifty-nine degrees, will retreat slightly as temperatures slip into the mid-fifties by day's end. The southwest breeze whispers at ten miles per hour, rustling the leaves, while the chance of precipitation rests at a cool sixty percent. Expect just a whisper of moisture that won’t overwhelm—an intricately delicate sprinkle, perhaps tracing upon the sidewalks and blending with the city’s eclectic charm.

As twilight approaches, the rain is likely to intensify, reinforcing an atmospheric thickness that obscures distant views yet wraps the city in a hushed embrace. The wind, shifting to the west-northwest and picking up with gusts reaching thirty-one miles per hour, will add a briskness that endeavors to penetrate even the coziest layers of clothing. A jacket and sturdy footwear are prudent; perhaps a hat to shield against errant drops that might slyly interrupt a quiet stroll. On a day like this, one might find solace within a local café, savoring a warm cup while peering out at the rain-soaked streets, or perhaps meander through an art gallery, letting the city’s spirit ignite one’s creativity.
